intro: Rhamnus pallasii subsp. iranica, commonly known as the Iranian buckthorn, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, oval leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
